greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Z(n) - L(n), where Z=A072649 and L=A095791 are lengths of Zeckendorf and lazy Fibonacci representations in binary notation.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(n)=0 if n is of the form F(k)-1 for k>=1 and a(n)=1 otherwise.
example: Zeckendorf-binary of 11 is 10100; lazy-Fibonacci-binary of 11 is 1111.
mathematica: m = Map[Length, t2] - Take[Map[Length, t1], Length[t2]] (* A095792 *)
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Jun 05 2004
